Name: Taihō (大鳳)
Fate: Sunk in the Battle of the Philippine Sea, 19 June 1944[1]
Displacement:
29,770 long tons (30,250 t) (standard);
37,270 long tons (37,870 t) (fully loaded)
Armament:
12 × 10 cm/65 Type 98 naval gun cal Type 98 anti-aircraft guns (6x2)
51 × Type 96 25 mm (0.98 in) anti-aircraft cannons (17x3)
Armor:
Belt: 55–152 mm (2.2–6.0 in) (waist); 40 mm (1.6 in) (below waterline)
Deck: 75–80 mm (3.0–3.1 in) (upper); 32 mm (1.3 in) (lower)
